intro: Macrolenes atrobrunnea, commonly known as the dark-brown macrolen, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its woody stems and heart-shaped leaves with a dark green upper surface and a lighter underside. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
